intro: Pavetta kurziana, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruit is a small, capsule that splits open to release seeds. Pavetta kurziana is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
